meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he uprest from his chair quickly.
meanings.sent2: The sun uprest over the horizon every morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat uprest on its hind legs to reach the treat on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her determination uprest her above all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon uprest into the sky, carrying its passengers with it.

meanings.definition: To rise up or stand up
meanings.sent1: The students uprest from their seats when the bell rang.
meanings.sent2: The tide began to uprest as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The toast in the toaster seemed to uprest too quickly, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The mountain uprest majestically against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The flowers uprest from the ground after the spring rain, reaching for the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To cause to rise up or stand up
meanings.sent1: The coach uprest the team's spirits with an inspiring speech.
meanings.sent2: The music uprest the crowd to dance and sing along.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to uprest the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her words uprest a sense of hope in the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock uprest him from his deep slumber, signaling the start of a new day.
